clinical_study.brief_title: Anti-CD19 CAR T Infusion Combined With Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplantation for B-cell Leukemia/Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study of Administrating CD19 Chimeric Antigen Receptor Expressing T Cells Followed by Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplantation in Patients With Refractory CD19+ B-linage Leukemia/Lymphoma

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical Univeristy

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical Univeristy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-arm open-label phase I study to determine the effect of CD19- CAR-T Cells infusion followed by allogeneic stem cell transplantation in safety, efficacy and engraftment potential in patients with CD19+ B-lineage leukemia and lymphoma.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objectives
1. To determine the safety and feasibility of allogeneic stem cell transplantation combined with adoptive transfer of T cells modified to express CD19-specific chimeric antigen receptor (CD19CAR) for treatment of leukemia and lymphoma Secondary objectives
2. To measure the efficacy of the CD19CAR T cell infusion combined with allogeneic stem cell transplantation

primary_outcome.measure: Safety - incidence of adverse events defined as dose-limited toxicity
primary_outcome.description: incidence of adverse events defined as dose-limited toxicity
